summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 discussing the classification of the Ghislaine Maxwell case (20 Cr 330) as a victim case within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The correspondence confirms the case is filed under the Epstein investigation (2018R01618) and involves coordination with a Victim Witness Coordinator.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain is ensuring her criminal case (20 Cr 330) is classified as a victim case.

persons.name: Victim Witness Coordinator
persons.context: The recipient of the initial email at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, responsible for victim case classification.

events.title: Request to Classify Maxwell Case as Victim Case
events.description: An initial email is sent requesting that the Ghislaine Maxwell case (20 Cr 330) be made sure to be classified as a victim case.

events.title: Confirmation of Case Classification and USAO Number
events.description: A reply confirms the Maxwell case is under the Epstein investigation with USAO number 2018R01618 and that it is classified as a victim case.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case is identified as docket number 20 Cr 330.
The case is administratively linked to the broader Epstein investigation under the USAO number 2018R01618.
There is explicit internal coordination to ensure the Maxwell case is classified and treated as a victim case.
The correspondence involves the Victim Witness Coordinator's office at the SDNY, highlighting victim-focused procedural handling.
The email chain dates from July 6-7, 2020, shortly after Maxwell's arrest.
